definition[0]: able to become strong, happy, or successful again after a difficult situation or event
example[1]: The company proved remarkably resilient during the recession.
definition[1]: strong and not easily damaged by being pulled, pressed etc
example[3]: Any chemical treatment will leave hair less resilient than before.
definition[2]: a resilient country, economy, currency etc is strong and performs well, even under difficult conditions
example[4]: The dollar proved resilient against the yen in trading yesterday.
